subject: Re: [junit]
msgSnippet: Think about what you are asking.  You are wondering whether you can pass arguments to a class you aren t running.  So the answer is No, you can t. You are
messageBody:
Think about what you are asking. You are wondering whether you can pass
arguments to a class you aren't running. So the answer is 'No, you can't.'
You are running the TestRunner whose argument is a test. If you need arguments
in your TestCase or TestSuite you can use Java properties
(-Dsome.property=someValue) on the command line.

-jason

--- "Friedli Beat [UFA AG Her]" <beat.friedli@...> wrote:

<HR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2 FACE="Arial">Hi </FONT>
</P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2 FACE="Arial">I have written a batch-file to start
swingui.TestRunner and pass as parameter the name of the class to test:</FONT>
</P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2 FACE="Arial">java junit.swingui.TestRunner
ufa.test.AllHttpTests</FONT>
</P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2 FACE="Arial">This works perfekt. But now I wold like to pass a
parameter to the class ufa.test.AllHttpTests. Is this somehow
possible?</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2 FACE="Arial">I had a look at the methode processArguments in
the class BaseTestRunner. It seams that there is now way to do so
<br>
